0iCXbEfWp211O5o9SmUkaQ.text: Grape pie! Great Dough, Brooklyn style, awesome choices for toppings very good, friendly service. How can you beat a pizza Brooklyn style pizza for 2 bucks a slice.

whl45-a_w96OVsGneK4wTw.text: Okay this place is worth the hype... My husband and I went here and we will definitely be back. The Elote flatbread is probably my favorite thing that we got. If you like the Elote from the fair and amazing crust, then this is the dish for you. We also split a pizza and got half carne asada and half southwest veggie- the green chile is killer and my husband said the carne asada is some of the best he's had. Also! If you like beer (which we do!) they have some solid taps and happy hour specials (double hooray!). The owner/manager is extremely personable and I felt we had great service.

CpdumFZsdZv-Gfl84TWzwg.text: Solid pizza shop. My favorite is simply getting a couple slices to go and have a Modelo on draft while I wait. This place can get pretty busy so there's a chance you'll have a wait. Perfect time for a drink to kill the time.

NmnGF2kmh2ADDFaa0-xa5A.text: We ordered three different slices and all of them were good. Randy, the owner gave us great customer service. Definitely a must try when in Phoenix

qCu92zGfJdxTm_SglCWCIQ.text: This place is absolutely incredible. From their custom creations to their more simple pepperoni pizza, there's no going wrong. Pizza is thin and crispy, topped with delicious fresh mozzarella and a tasty not over bearing sauce.   Their wings left a bit to be desired but next time I'll just try one of their amazing sounding sandwhiches instead. The wings weren't as crispy as I like and they were a bit skimpy with the sauce, but all the different dipping sauce options are delectable.  The location itself is spacious, situated nearly behind a Bosa donut shop, in a large strip mall. Many of the tables include a built in checkers board so the wait for dining in flies by. Their menu is written on a large chalkboard behind the bar and to the side, its definitely overwhelming with all the delicious culinary options to try from. Without a doubt some of the best pizza in town, especially in Arcadia.

dYSsHX-uxUxeKZ9B4KcSVQ.text: So awesome! We had the southwest veggie pizza. Great flavors, real friendly customer service. Playing checkers with my teenagers was fun while we waited for our pizza!

MquOVB7WT4GYnlNv1Ygr9g.text: Cool pizzeria! The menu is Mexican Italian infused. 2 foods I love. We've always ordered for delivery so we've never visited the parlor it's self but the quality of food in the flavors have always been excellent. The salads are good too

MO1i52T1itPe2VNHb7yMuA.text: Excellent new pizza joint!  Great service with friendly people.   The owner, Randy, is cool and genuinely appreciates the customer.  We had the Southwest Veggin Out, a Traditional NY Style and an El Blanco.  All three were delicious and the El Blanco was out of this world.  The tag line; "Where NY meets the Southwest" is right on!  My Slice of the Pie will quickly rank among he best in Greater Phoenix and don't be surprised if you see more of them all over the valley.  Can't wait to try more options on the menu and they are starting to deliver so I can get it right at my door! Go before there is a long wait!

cq8EMHu4iBA7vUxDMikhlw.text: The Yelp reviews are spot on: The pizza here is de-lish. If you're in Arcadia its a local spot well worth trying. The pizza has a thick crust that isn't dry (Im a Missouri girl who loves flat STL style pizza so if I'm impressed with thick crust that means its truly impressive). They pile on the toppings and there are all sorts of fun pizzas including some southwest style pies with a spicy sauce. Management is super friendly - you can tell the owner has a great rapport with the customers coming in. Next time you're craving pizza close down your Dominos app and go support this yummy local pizzeria.

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So many veggies  vegetarian pizza heaven
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Listen to the tomato!

YGnT2XulrM34066M-akJEQ.text: The pizza here is average for the Phoenix metro area.  The pizza had the perfect level of cheese, meat and oil, yet the crust was a complete letdown.  The crust simply lacked flavor and was tough to chew through.  The meat and cheese included in the salad were delicious, but overall the salad was bland.

AToJuqErjz4gdQ5X46fj7g.text: They do have slices in evenings now. I got a mushroom slice and a pepperoni slice. 2 slices filled me up. Good crust  and great sauce. Friendly cashier, and the cook came out to ask if everything was ok. He did that to all tables not just me. Maybe the owner?

nqkuXSwmwoBbBy4ZXCQvaA.text: Omg. GREAT customer service. Very informative at the counter. Excellent, flavorful salad and pizzas!

mtf21emOOhkgxbvMR3o6GQ.text: So there I was, off to find a pizza replacement for the old Frank's. Didn't think it would be possible. But boom! There it was. Better than than the last. Yep, I can't say my house is terribly hard to please with pizza but I am. My Slice of Pie Pizzeria made snapped me out of my loss over Franks pizza real quick. This pizza has a perfect crust and they are so nice. Thanks for coming to Arcadia!

u-_f8nDfshswJiGFDJRtBg.text: Can't get enough of this place! Very friendly staff and AMAZING pizza! Al Pastor pizza is our favorite

oQJxPNSCyKefENSYUrIKQg.text: I was in Charlotte North Carolina sipping my coffee one early morning when a friend of mine posted a picture of the Al Pastor pizza. I was flying back to Phoenix that night and I knew where I had to go.  My first stop after picking up my car was my slice of the Pie Pizza I ordered the pizza to go but ended up eating it there, it was delicious and so worth it. The staff was also very friendly and made me feel right at home, I will definitely back and I recommend my slice of the pie to anyone in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CpWq9vhpy5RSDOPz973syA.text: I ordered 2 pizzas and I'm in love. By far some of the best pizza I've had in phx and I've been here 20 yrs. I can't wait until my next cheat day. I had the original supreme and I believe the ...idk but it was delicious with a good amount of kick. I'm picky about my pizza so this is my new place. Price around $12 per pizza can't beat it with a stick.

PtJrVhl9AmeinPWaT2PJZQ.text: I'm from NYC, been in Phoenix for one week and I'm fairly sure I've found the best pizza in the city. We had the Supremo and the El Blanco, both absolutely delicious. The crust was ALMOST the perfect amount of crunch. I'm coming back for the El Pastor. Keep in mind they can make you gluten free pies upon request!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

X7kfPJb04uhk6YrL343W9g.text: AHHHHmazing pizza! Just ordered today for a company meeting and the pizza was phenomenal. We're new to the neighborhood and they threw in extra cheesecake for us to try, along with cheesy bread and a carne asada pizza. Such a welcoming gesture! Overall can't speak more highly of the pizza at My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria.

GncgvTwoMHgaP-i--xDohA.text: Great food, great service. Visiting from the northeast & loved the NY style pizza for the kids & impressed by the flavor of the southwest style. Loved playing checkers with the kids while we waited. Definitely recommend this for pizzas of all kinds & sandwiches too!

VUe96w2yV_3GxBWnlri5Mw.text: I heard about this place on the radio. JOHNJAY from 1047 was talking about it so I had to try.  I ordered 3 pizzas and 2 dozen wings for my father's day pool party with the family. Not only was the pizza delicious (and unique!) , the customer service was even more impressive.  I had a special order and it got slightly miscommunicated but they were so quick and helpful to fix (and I actually got more than I paid for) the small flub. Ill definently be back! Try the El Pastor!

fomW_lompkL2jtwZXU_eLQ.text: Came here because of good reviews and location. We were hopeful to have their new carne asada Pizza but they had sold out of it (the meat?). We tried the Al Pastor (and a small pepperoni) and both were good.   The place is cute, tucked back in a strip mall, my reason for 4 stars is the wait time. It was very very slow and others were in there who seemed to be having the same experience. Since it was our first visit I don't know if this is normal and would absolutely visit again - but do so knowing it might take a lot longer than advertised.

WPzq4q3eLVB8kETi-4c1QQ.text: Fantastic pizza! To reiterate the other reviews, the Al Pastor is amazing and pretty much anything with the southwest sauce is delicious. Also the staff are super friendly and are more than accommodating!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eSqSEAKKY73cBXMH2Ks8Eg.text: HOLY MOLY, that's a good pizza pie. Lol. But seriously, Arcadia is a hot bed for good pizza and these guys are cutting themselves a pretty good Slice of that business by being awesome. The Pizza was really good, with fresh ingredients, and it's larger than their competition at LGO and Nook for about the same price. I'd get in there now before everyone realizes how amazing this place is and you have to wait... the dining room is on the smaller side and they don't serve booze, but they are only a few doors down from The Pigs Meow and I have it on good authority from their ownership their that you can bring these delicious mouthwatering pies into their bar.     They say New York style, but the staff and ownership are way to nice to be New York, "style". The wait was gonna be a little long on our pie so the owner(I think he was the owner) gave us a slice of cheesecake... DAMN it was tasty, and local to boot.    I will be going back and I'm happy to say that this is defiantly one of the best pizza places in Phoenix and probably my favorite now.

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Z_VeuEmlsNEEnpn7hksvMA.text: In my 37 years, of the best pizza places I ever been to. Great authentic New York pies to specialties like their Al Carbon.

Xzq6LiIrd67sFMbZQ-VLDA.text: Great pie! Great art! Great owner! We were gushing over his creativity and he then suggested the dessert. With all the amazing pizza we didn't even think of getting dessert but wow we were happy we did! The cleanliness could use some work but its a pizza place and our tummies were happy so its hardly worth complaining about. I can't wait to go back. Thank you!!

acGPtUm2Pm4aGS02gdBJjA.text: In town from Wisconsin, based on yelp reviews we ordered 2 large for our girls weekend!  The pizza was AMAZING!  Had a margarita and c/p/m/t.  We loved them both!  The owner delivered and followed up.  Love it when owners take that much pride, and give great service.

7IwHNBZvrd3RwOhnrKKwzg.text: We got this pizza for pick up and it was super tasty. Perhaps not quite as quality ingredients as others, but definitey satisfying. We got one pepperoni & extra cheese and it was the quintessential greasy classic pizza. I found it delish, but my body didn't like it as much...if you know what I mean. Great for a big pizza party. :)

rGDKj8UAPHkjVm7-RhibwA.text: This place offers a unique spin on pizza combining delicious southwestern/Mexican flavors on a pizza crust with special, subtly spicy sauce or a traditional pizza sauce if you prefer. Definitely try the Al Pastor and Carne Asada slices! While the food is great, I also love supporting small businesses. The service is stellar!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al Pastor and Carne Asada slices...yum!

qUIhCljMHiVH7d8HlMeDzg.text: No complaints here.  Had a wonderful experience.  Pizza baked fresh when ordered. The young kid at the register was super awesome and made great suggestions.  Blue cheese dip for the crust just sealed the deal of an awesome experience.  Be back soon

MK3pHY-C9GgnW_AEv6fN9A.text: Recommend based on a few slices my wife and I tried. The owners and employees were very engaging and appears they truly love working there. This place should do well, looking forward to next trip to Arcadia for some additional slices

jJYxl55e81_GTVtR8sHVAQ.text: This is the best NY style pizza in town. The crust is perfect, sauce is awesome and there is a good portion of toppings. In a town with a lot of good pizza, this places reigns supreme. In addition, the customer service is exactly what other restaurants should aspire to achieve. The owner cares about his customers and makes sure your pizza and experience are memorable.

BPyPn7qG_y021xQw7MamUA.text: I have eaten here 4 times since its opening and am extremely impressed with not only the exceptional menu, but the customer service is 2nd to none...Randy is hands on, friendly, informative and makes the place a fun place to eat... The pastor pizza pops with flavors and the wings are tasty with just the right crisp...the Italian sandwiches are great and anytime you can have the cucumber ranch take advantage and put it in everything!!! I can go on and on, this place is definitely a great addition to the neighborhood and another choice for good eats on any given night... Keep up the great work!!!

IIPsy-FWX6gcbJL2x8EAkg.text: This was my first time eating here. I ordered the rise like a phoenix salad and it was one of the best salads I've had in a long time! I ordered it for pick up, it was ready when I got there and they were friendly to make it better!

KSHVbgfZBPKRDLGxXmiQvA.text: So So so good!!!  WOW. So happy I finally tried this amazing place. And it's so close to us. My NEW pizza spot

mNpZAS5OlmgyMi3LeW8xxA.text: Absolutely fantastic. The owners enthusiasm is unbelievable  and it translates to the delicious  pizza as well. Started out with a salad very very good had the ceaser. Then ordered the largest size pizza with pepperoni and fire roasted artichokes. Wow the quality of ingredients  can be tasted in every bite. I am eating some slices that I took home and 3 days later it tastes delicious. Homemade dough as well! Can't wait to try the wings and sandwiches. Welcome to the neighborhood Randy!!!

8xOlkwvfrP6C6yDg_nkAMw.text: The supremo, as multiple other users have already said, is extremely delicious. It's a great combination of flavors. Don't forget the special (cucumber/chile?) ranch! This is definitely a different, yet fresh spin on pizza.  I've only ate here once, but just placed another order. This time I'm trying the Al Pastor..I'll follow up.  Edit 1: Al Pastor is amazing. My 2nd favorite, following the Supremo.   Edit 2: Another visit. I tried their Italian sandwich and chorizo meatball. Both are pretty good and come with a really tasty salad. Definitely a good option if you're not ordering an entire pizza for mutliple people.

PjfaXce81E7HqLD30xczfg.text: My mom sent me your Yelp link and I was drooling looking at pictures. She ordered two pizzas, one pepperoni and one mushroom and sausage. The pizza had good flavor, but the crust is nearly impossible to bite through or even chew because it is SO chewy! She isn't a big crust eater, but I am, and even she thought the crust was difficult to eat. Of the three pieces I've eaten so far, I eat the pie and toss the crust because it just isn't worth breaking my teeth. Two fairly small pizzas for $32 and they were less than perfect - not sure we will order pizza from here again. :(

c3Otb46w6eNMVGIn7fqzGQ.text: Love love love My Slice of the Pie. Simply the best pizza in the Valley. It's consistently cooked to perfection, especially when ordered Southwestern style. Along with the cravable food, the service is amazing. The owner and cashiers are always friendly and helpful. Hidden gem in the Arcadia neighborhood.

Yn2cEPeWKwHT0o7Ie-AYOQ.text: My Slice of Pie may now be my favorite pizza joint. My go to pizza is very simple, so I started with that and got a slice of pepperoni. It came out hot and fresh, there was plenty of sauce and cheese and the taste was spectacular. You can tell that these folks use quality ingredients. The crust was nice and crunchy with just enough chewiness to make it something special.  Because I felt like I had to try it I got the AL PASTOR WHAT? Pizza to go and was blown away. It's full of flavor and had some sweet and spicy qualities; not to mention all of the ingredients were absolute quality. This place is new but the pizza tastes like they've been around for years.   Aside from the food the vibe is great. Built in checkerboards on the high top table and a cool mural on the wall.

8nmC6eIboI7EsFwsth3SXg.text: How is this pizza so good???? I got the Supremo pizza (large) and it was one of the best pizzas I have ever had...in this area of town! I really liked the ingredients on the pizza: the chorizo was spicy, red onion and roasted corn were full of flavor. I even enjoyed eating just the crust! I can't wait to go back and try the El Pastor. I enjoyed talking to the guy who I assume runs the place because any one can tell he has a passion for making good pizza! The inside of the place has a good vibe and I like the painting of Camelback on the wall. 10/10 will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Supremo so gooooood

wdsZjOsDzO5fGD5phyq1iw.text: This place is awesome!! Super kid friendly, games and a fun staff. Very accommodating and engaged service. The owner seems like a great guy, he brought out dough for the kids to play with and then baked it for them. We got the southwest veggie pizza, lots of flavor and very delicious! We'll be back with our friends soon!

I5Q4huq0hgjtH02fnBGEYw.text: Heard about this place while listening to Jon J. and Rich on the radio so I decided to check it out while visiting for a Diamondbacks baseball game. First off, the pizza at this place is awesome! Don't be discouraged by its location or size. There are plenty of options on the menu, but if you are going to try anything go with the El Pastor pizza, it is by far the best one!

dTdasBu2kap3XtbG7Gg8fA.text: I ordered from here 3 or 4 times. My family likes NY style pizza and this place is right in our neighborhood. I like that the pizza has fresh basil and good flavored cheese. However, my kids are not a fan. They dont like the sauce, too pastey. The also dont care for the basil.  The crust needs some work as it  has had too many air bubbles and over cooked....way too crunchy. Impossible to eat left overs as the crust hardens like a brick.

juZ17FSnKhpqTDfNYk4dbw.text: Recently had a pizza here and it isn't the same pizza that I fell in love with when this place first opened and I would drive across town to have some. Not sure what has happened.

qHn9Ksy-P4xjlu9bxgCwYA.text: This pizza is not good. It's like a Fresh veggie plate on a pizza. Wings are great but he the pizza is NOT GOOD.  If your in the area go to Gino's.

FymbakyigJv7qgOGmZVn9A.text: Today was my second time going and it is great. I've had the pepperoni, Al Pastor and Carne pizzas. I think I like the Al Pastor the best...so far. Very affordable and good portion size. Not far from home and the owner is a lovable guy. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al Pastor at My Slice of The Pie
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My daughter at My Slice of The Pie

NDI9WamAXXguCL74xh17Jw.text: Finally had a chance to try this spot, and I'm already thinking about the next time I get to stuff my face again! We ordered the infamous El Pastor pizza, and the only thing I hated was that I got the 12" and didn't have enough leftovers. Everything about it is perfect. We also ordered a custom pizza, and the red sauce was so flavorful. The dough/crust on both pizzas were chewy with a snap, and never got soggy. Again, can't wait for our next pizza night to try more creations! Bravo!

fREpC3TBwajSvXSlCmzZyQ.text: I finally found a Pizzeria that is worth going to in Phoenix. Being from New Jersey I hold pizza to a very high standard and this reminds me of all the great pizza joints in Jersey and NY. I had their two specialty pizzas and you can tell they have quality cheese along with homemade sauce. Also I talked to the owner and he was a very down to earth guy I will definitely be going there twice a week. Also their ooey goey cake is the best cake I've ever had even better than maestros butter cake... and yes I said it's better than their butter cake

nEhjOkouxR11aui3MKOrig.text: From start to finish, incredible service. Quick and delicious. Huge portions. Very clean and on top of their stuff. Always so friendly and great sitting down environment! My favorite pizza spot in Arcadia!

Jha2LhuHEnbkamLpe6uBig.text: PSA: THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE PIZZA JOINT!   AND i'm absolutely obsessed with it.   My husband and I live SO close and JUST NOW made it in. I'm kicking myself for taking so long! We had the pleasure of meeting and chatting with the passionate owner about his journey as a small business owner and how he came up with this remarkable concept. We left SO inspired. He is truly an amazing guy!  No onto the food! To start, we split the Against-Pasta salad and it was SO delicious. Extra crispy and COLD lettuce with meats, cheeses, GRILLED in-house artichoke hearts, cucumbers, red onion, green peppers, and black olives. It is a BIG salad so I highly encourage splitting it if you're getting pizza too (which duh, you better be getting pizza too!).   I ordered a slice of their Carne Asada pizza because I had planned on eating more salad (trying to be healthy, you know - this whole new year, new you thing is really getting to my head!). ;) And after the first bite, I wished that we had ordered an entire pizza. YOU GUYS - the carne asada pizza is literally one of the best things ever! Do yourself a favor and get it. There were so many tasty ingredients on top that I can't even begin to list them all but trust me, you'll be obsessed too. THE CRUST. That was one of the best parts. It was the perfect combination of crispy and chewy, with a little char on it. YES. I LOVE that they incorporate so many unique sauces and flavors when coming up with their pizza combinations.   DANG, MSOTPP, you're onto something! We can't wait to come back!! We'll definitely be getting a slice of that cheesecake next time, too!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Against Pasta Salad - they literally grill the artichokes in house!
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. YOU GUYS - this is the pizza of dreams! Carne Asada heaven!

HYLpNWhKWUa_oJ2ILeGd-A.text: My hubby and I wanted to try a new pizza place that will rock our taste buds. I'm so happy we chose this place. We ordered their carne asada pizza, blanca pizza, and their famous meatballs. Let's just say our carryout order did not make it home in one piece. The best aroma kept coming out of the pizza box on our way home and my hubby couldn't help himself. He immediately gave it the thumbs up and was upset we didn't order a bigger pizza pie.  This place is now one of our favorites!

a-Ou5pH9_8ZeXUsR2P0xUA.text: I'm just going to keep this short and simple. So. Freakin. Good. I love pizza and I love this pizza... We were boring and just got a plain pepperoni and devoured it in MINUTES! It's worth a try for sure!

mP0sDsZqMES3kaLlyneBrQ.text: Great little pizzeria offering delicious slices of pizza, chicken wings, and homemade meatballs. The guy that took our order acted as if he was an owner and had a great pride in the food and service, ensuring that he answered all of our questions, offered suggestions, and provided everything we needed to have a delicious meal. We started with the garlic cheese bread, a great sized portion that came with a side of red sauce. We tried the al pastor and carne asada specialty slices as well as a pep and sausage slice. Each was very flavorful, large in size, and reasonably priced. I can't wait to go back to try the homemade meatballs, if they are half as good as the sausage then they are sure to be amazing!

5lz82CRwa4VSd-lGVmkQZA.text: Best pizza in town! Love this place! I go there so often that the owner Randy knows our order by heart! Also love supporting this place because Randy is a military Vet and I always love supporting Veterans!!  Semper Fi!!

FF60rk6eezF0HF-wZDRcXQ.text: My new favorite pizza EASILY. The NY style is perfect. Southwestern style also fantastic. The crust is unreal. I will likely eat here once a week, it's that fucking great. The Elote flatbread was one of the greatest things I have ever put into my mouth hole. Seriously. Customer service 10/10, Randy = cool dude. If I owned a pizza joint, that guy would run the show. I really wish I had more friends to tell about this restaurant. I truly regret not having found this place earlier in life. Ate there, but also took a pizza to go. One of the best decisions I've made in my entire life. I'm excited to be hungry again.

z1J_A4H7Dj6HZUv5JYZMrQ.text: BEST pizza we could find in AZ.. closest thing to NJ pizza out here. Wings were great too!

EsEPKv1KmdVCycLjNoLgdQ.text: Pizza done proper.   NY style. Don't get me wrong it's not going to beat Rays, Ray's, Ray's, Joe's or Joe's in NYC, but's it's certainly a top contender in Phoenix.

Yp6JuBC7B-Xjd2OIGTEl5A.text: This is some of the best New York style pizza in Arizona! I moved to central Phoenix and found this spot on here and wasn't disappointed. They are consistently awesome!

urgqY802aHcf6sNBpIp9lA.text: I've gotten pizza twice here since moving to Phoenix a couple of weeks ago. When it comes to pizza, the thing I find most important is the crust. This pizzeria does not disappoint, hitting the right level of crunch. They also offer a wide variety of unique pizzas and an okay variety of beers. If you're looking for a new pizza place to try, I'd definitely stop by!

U1f27UyzxR5gRgrJ7CxJ8Q.text: 2 words: Al Pastor! I'm never disappointed, love this place! They even sell it by the slice!

CHJjdX1daXffgUea41lU0Q.text: Best pizza in Arizona. Not the typical neopolitan BS you get everywhere else. Finally a joint that hits on all phases. Great crisp, great sauce, great crust. This place is out of the way for me but I will go out of my way for it. No question

puA2xJAVK22Z_5Kcusek7w.text: truly impressed by this place. they have a super fun menu, all house made sauces and dough. their pizza is AMAZING. and i look forward to returning to try the rest of the menu! also the owner, randy was incredibly kind, helpful, and enthusiastic. this is the type of place locals want to support!

8iDH3CKwwjeTBFuoYK0xVw.text: I want to start out by saying that I love that My Slice of the Pie is right next door to The Whining Pig, because pizza & beer is life.   I'm a simple kind of pizza eater. I will eat any pizza, but I simply love a basic pepperoni pizza. This place truly nails it with the sauces! I'm a huge fan of their original red sauce, but they have some other great options that everyone should try. Their Al Pastor & El Blanco pizzas are delicious, especially if you like a more intricate pizza.   This place is my go to for pizza! They even allow you to order slices & will on occasion deliver them to you while your at The Whining Pig next door if they aren't too busy. Amazing customer service! The owner Randy is always around, working hard & being awesome!

EFJrsCZEGsyn3A9Paf6rqQ.text: Pizza had good flavor of ingredients. The wings were good. The customer service was excellent and friendly atmosphere.

Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Supreme pizza

-ocnWIiXkZDXFCWZ1lT6lg.text: Great taste and great pizza! Man this place had really good sauce options for wings as well as pizzas. The manager was great and let us try out all their options. Overall, this was a great experience. It's also a very cozy restaurant, a place I really enjoyed being at. Great ambiance, great aesthetic, amazing pizza!

Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i6U8gBuLzkh2udfLSRbfKg.text: What great surprise! A Real deal great pizza. With in store made dough, red sauce and sausage. Not to be missed, if you ready for a better Pizza.

ZkB5ln4-uLfFeo0bek3FyA.text: This place was was fire. Super friendly staff.   They have a long communal table where you can sit close with other people and eat meet talk watch tv together. Very cool camelback mural. Music was not to loud just right for this environment. Thin but sturdy crust. Good vibes I'll go back.

HXCXfUgXR-IDGQY9mz1iYw.text: What unique pizza toppings and flavors. It's done really well and the prices are very fair. The staff is friendly and great.

_DmF16emZqLzezCqPKMmuQ.text: I ordered a slice for lunch. Great flavor but you could tell it wasn't freshly made. The crust was very hard like a cracker and cheese wasn't soft. Not really worth the 20 minute wait for a slice.   Next time I'll order a whole pizza so it's fresh--hopefully.

x-LfuNtvcl2Vy4UXNgz9UQ.text: Love the NY style pepperoni and jalapeno pizza!!!! I drive all the way from Chandler to eat it, so delish. The Al pastor pizza is also a must there.

nlxc3hwNkxcCyePIBBbGBQ.text: This is by far the best pizza I've had. I love the atmosphere and the customer service is outstanding! My go to place in AZ!!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We had the honor of trying the first Carne Asada pizza. Highly recommend it! Delicious!

MD-Pm2T8CBvmER6ErbrloQ.text: Had the El Blanco and was my first order. Heard alot of great reviews and decoded to order. Pizza looked amazing the way I imagined it. Within 5min of taking the pizza home it was cold not warm or hot as well. I enjoyed it a lot just wish the pizza was hot or at temp*

-5mgfmJO0fRVGe3VTbKn8A.text: So my little brother was going out of town and had left over Carne Asada and Al Pastor slices in his fridge from the day before.  He insisted I take them and I am so glad he did!  DELICIOUS!!!  I reheated them in the oven added hot sauce and some fresh cilantro and YUMMMMMM!  I can't wait to go back and try some fresh pies!  That Carne Asada is the star !

KukC1SrY2YwoTyukLEhvew.text: Was looking for some food last night on Yelp and was shocked to see a nearby pizza place with 5 stars. Decided to order a large pizza and a meatball sandwich. The large pizza is bigger than you'd expect, which is great since you'll have leftovers. It's also a damn good and managed to still be good even after being re-heated in the microwave the next day, which is rare for any pizza. The meatball sandwich was decent but didn't really blow my shorts up. Honestly, the pizza was good enough that I don't care and will definitely be back. Check this place out if you want an excellent pizza without spending a fortune.

3ZSAynKBOW6uZNCLhIb_ZQ.text: For an easy to go pizza this place is fantastic; they experiment with different flavors and have no issues making any changes to your choice of pie.

xapUCX3bYXdGF4PVepBZjg.text: This is by far my favorite new pizza shop. If your in the arcadia area, I strongely recommend stopping by and having a slice or two. The al pastor, and  anything with the southwest style sauce is delicious, as was everything else that I've tried. I dont think I've ever experienced better customer service.   After being there a few times now, its become obvious that their owner Randy is doing an outstanding job running this shop and he's just fun to talk to. Last week we ordered a pizza for carry out and once I got home I realized that they accidentally forgot to include an ingredient on our pizza. This didnt bother me, as the pizza was still delicious. As I sat down to eat, I got a call from the shop acknowledging that they had realized this. I was promply offered that my next visit would be compensated, which I happily took advantage of tonight.   They definitely go the exta mile when it comes to customer service, and their quality of pizza is hard to beat. Oh, and they have checkers boards built into the table to play while you wait for your food.

4w-458ky6hFAVabHMIh38A.text: Seriously amazing pizza.  A must try! I dont typically care for speciality pizza...but I was adventurous and tried the Al Pastor pizza. I could eat that pizza for the rest of my life! This place is doing something right! Super friendly staff too

rEZK3oHE61SlFvoOdN1btA.text: Loved My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria! We ordered an 18 inch pepperoni with basil for take-out and when we arrived to pick it up, the gentleman gave us an extra slice because he thought the pizza had looked a little small. We were both shocked because nobody had ever done something like that before! He was very friendly, not just to us, but to all the other customers there (I'm assuming he was the owner). Loved the pizza! Great flavor, not too greasy, and big slices. Didn't think it was on the smaller side at all ,but greatly appreciated the extra slice of deliciousness!! Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They added a slice because the pizza looked small to them. Love it!!

X4x64BvwA6w1xzHHegG9_A.text: I am a Chicago native, so please let that reflect on my review. I am currently on my third slice of The Supreme Being, and have already had a serving of The Rising Phoenix salad-- both are quite delicious.  My Slice Of The Pie is a really, really great "I've Had A Long Day and Just Really Need Some Quality Pizza Delivered To Me" type of place-- I've not been in the restaurant, so can't comment on that.  The tomato sauce on my pizza was yummy in a slightly sweet way, the amount of ingredients was very generous, and the seasoning was just right.  The salad was really delightful and unique, refreshing with a kick.  Customer service was also great: the fellow who took my order on the phone informed me that I was out of their delivery range, but made an exception because they weren't super busy (Tuesday night)-- I did not expect this at all, and found it quite generous of them.  Even my delivery guy was very polite and friendly!  When I judge things, I judge them based on what they ARE-- I've seen some reviews of this place that seem to expect My Slice to be a gourmet, white tablecloth kind of pizza. That's not what this is trying to be. There are different kinds of great pizza, this is the everyday "go-to" kind that I will order on nights when I just don't really feel like cooking.  Oh! Also (to that point) VERY awesome pricing for the food that you get.  Even if I need to carry out in the future, I'll definitely be returning.

4N_YjgBRK8UxvNRZGHLS1A.text: Tried this place out after hearing about it from another friend in the neighborhood - and really glad I did.  Pizza was fantastic and there's enough variety in the menu to keep us trying out new combinations for many trips to come.  (I do highly recommend getting  the jalapeno spread on your pizza)  My only issue, seems to be one that was mentioned by few other reviewers.  The wings are coming out just a bit dry.  On one hand, it's nice that they have a crunch to them - hell, some places utilize potato starch with the whole goal of obtaining / maintaining that level of crunch once sauced.  But in my opinion, the whole issue could be fixed by thickening up their buffalo sauce.  Start with a light roux base before adding in the cayenne pepper and then supplement the burn by adding additional peppers (or pepper sauce) - because let's be honest - roux will reduce it a bit.    By thickening the sauce, it'll stick to the wings better and allow them to come out with a better texture.  That said, love this place.  Will be back. Will bring friends.

Am0VF8YjpnvkEOYqpRzEPA.text: Great NY style pizza. I have been looking for traditional east coast style pizza since I have moved out here. They have nailed it, also if you want to kick it up a little try the southwest style pizza sauce.

iP4mI-z7vi6JLFjuoXPHvA.text: Man, I really wanted to like this place.  I'm always weary of these "NY style" pizza joints because 99% of the time they're not NY style at all.  Clue number one that I would be disappointed - the cheese didn't stretch. Plus the sauce had no flavor. OK fine, won't be NY style but it will still be edible right?  Well as several other reviewers have mentioned, you have to put in work to eat the crust! So hard to chew after one slice that my jaw hurts.I was hungry but I had to throw in the towel after that first slice.

LylzVM0f60IXVeD3mYLYGA.text: This is my favourite pizza place in phoenix...  I find myself here once a month at least...  sometimes once a week.  The "al pastor what?" is an incredible fusion of NY pie, and the south west,  you cannot go wrong?

_y6DZ8qxcUAH7Hu1kZSZsQ.text: This pizza was phenomenal! We ordered five different kinds and each one was not disappointing! Their use of Mexican flair still has my mouth watering! My favorite was the southwest veggie out!

UtiqyniceTD4FsA7Weer5w.text: Okay, I'm updating because tonight on my second journey here I was lucky enough to meet the owner Randy. You can totally tell he cares about customer service. I was able to try something he was testing, Carne Asada Pizza, OMG it was the most amazing thing I've ever had. I'm not kidding. So flavorful and honestly better on a pie then a taco. If you haven't tried this place, I suggest you get there fast!!!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet &amp; Sassy Wings, and Carne pizza!!!!!!! The best!

sc5Wc5E4ECvldefYYhG_jA.text: Just down right good NY food. Great vibes. Fresh topping sauce and dough. Definitely worth stopping in and checking out

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OZnuk0SQ97Bvm-Sn3V554g.text: Been in Phoenix since last year and have been trying different pizza places and this is the best I've found so far. Went for home delivery and it can piping hot. Got an Al Pastor and a regular pepperoni. Al Pastor is a vegi with some unique ingredients. It tastes great and has some spice to it...great. The pepperoni was excellent. The best thing is the crust, thin but at the end it is very chewy and tasty. Definitely will go again

mhVh4-uf48s8Hod-YHjp7w.text: Holy hot dang it this is good pizza.   I'm visiting from LA, from NY and I am a pizza SNOB. We ordered an 18" cheese pizza with fresh pepperccinis and I must say, I said "WOW YUM" quite a few times while we were eating it. This is not fluffy froo-froo pizza; this is fantastic deep flavored New York style pizza that you will think about if you have leftovers. Delish even when left out all night (were in a hotel).   The fella I chatted with on the phone was very pleasant as well. Grubhub did a good job of getting it to us still hot.   I am a total fan and would eat this pizza every day if it wouldn't make me Jabba the Hut. BLESS!!!

pmK0q8tsPTQkm2JVjcUz9w.text: Small pizza joint with big flavor. Ordered two pies to go and both had great flavor. I was surprised that you could get half and half on speciality pizzas, as long as the base sauce was same.   The guy at the counter was friendly, order was ready when they said it would be, small place with a few booths and high tops too.   Only reason I'm not giving them 5 is because the crust was chewy, tasted good, but chewy.   Ordered the Southwest veg, carne asada and supreme. The supreme was as expected, the other two were awesome.   Definitely a repeat customer and looking forward to trying other items on the menu.  Service: 5 Ambiance: 3.5 Food: 4

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QVxtJnzT32lNV3QjkUXAdw.text: Omg..omg....omg.  By far THE BEST pizza in the country.  And i have lived in NY, New England, LA, Las Vegas and spent time in Chicago....  This place beats any "best pizza in ENTER STATE HERE".  they cater to every style of pizza from traditional italian american to thier unique take on southwestern sauce.  My fave is southwest with extra cheese.   Food baby time!!

YXaee1aNZpnQ0jLUYoctkw.text: Honestly one of the best slices of pizza I've ever had. Crust was thin New York style and the el pastor flavors were SO good! Love the combination of pork, pineapple, cilantro, onion, and all the other goodness. Workers were friendly and helpful! One of the more specialty slices such as the el pastor was around $4 but the slice was pretty dang big. Will be coming back FO SHO!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. El pastor pizza

6LvtYBigOEELrEuX_YAtXg.text: Seriously, the crust was the worst. Please read the lower star reviews, we are telling it like it is! Ever put leftover pizza in the microwave and the crust is super hard and impossible to chew? That's what we got. It was like they premade the pizza, froze it and nuked it before we picked up! My jaw hurts. I have no need to share where I am from and how I KNOW good pizza cause I am from NY. Whatever, who cares. it was NOT GOOD. Nice people and good service aside, the pizza was awful. Sad because I do prefer to frequent mom and pop/family owned business.

b9cGn0b47PG01cKAznVf3Q.text: Finally got to try this place! It's been in my bookmarks for awhile and we finally made it out to this side of town to try it. We can honestly say we were not disappointed! There were 3 of us so we decided to start with the Against Pasta Salad. In all honesty, it was OK - not as good as I was anticipating based on previous reviews. It seemed like there was a lot more lettuce and not as much meat and cheese as other reviewers stated. The dressing was really good though. Their slices are pretty big - we ordered 2 of the You Gotta Carne Asada and they were superb! Just the right amount of heat and the dough was perfect! The perfect balance of sturdiness to pick it up in one slice and take a bite with the doughy goodness of pizza! We also ordered the El Blanco pizza and it was really good as well! As my fellow diner commented, "It left my pallet so satisfying. It was like a crispy communion wafer topped with a delectable mixture!" We also got the wings and they were great. Especially liked the BBQ Mole sauce! I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You Gotta Carne Asada Pizza
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jumbo Drumettes
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jumbo Drumettes

S02fgAg3n2WfipTi6q36jg.text: We've been ordering from My Slice for years and has been great. Tonight we ordered thru Postmates and there was an issue of a missing salad and a pizza mistake. The owner Randy answered the phone and couldn't have been nicer. He admitted to the issue and then immediately put in an order for another pie and he personally delivered the pizza along the missing salad. Brilliant customer service!  There, at some point, will be an issue, no matter how fantastic the place. I always look at how it's handled. Randy couldn't have been a more exemplary owner with his customer service tonight and his delicious pizza always. Kudos to business owners like Randy that REALLY care!!!

EkKuIgqOYEDtkZOTPK-ywg.text: Had the carne asada pie, and a mushroom pie both were very good.  Also had the regular  bone in wings sassy sauce wings cooked just right and the sauce was tasty.  A little out of my way but would like to try some of their other creations.

fsq0NGoI8_oHKVLyBEmL3w.text: I nearly cried eating this pizza...YUP! it was an emotional experience! Seriously, it's the best pizza I've ever had! For someone who grew up in the east coast, I think that's saying a lot!   As we live super close to this place, I'm not sure how we've managed to order pizza from every other crappy place but THIS until this week! We called in our order and it was ready in 20 minutes or so. When I arrived, I had a chance to chat with the owner who was extremely friendly! It's also not bad inside to dine in. There was a cool bar area and they carry a large variety of beer and wine.   For our pizzas, we ordered Southwest Veggin Out,  supreme , and pepperoni . We LOVED our pizzas! My Southwest Veggin out was full of flavor, topped with the most delicious veggies, and the crust was crisp and thin.   I don't care if you live in downtown Phoenix or Flagstaff, you need to try the pizza here! I don't think we'll ever order from another place as long as we live here!!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest Veggin Out- Soo good!

bNVaIr5yw4t5UsUQ8tbLVg.text: Was in the area while my son was at football practice did a quick search for NY style pizza and yelp took us to pizza on 40th pies looked ok but lacked indoor cool seating so did another search and BOOM glad I did My Slice Of The Pie was amazing from the first moment you walk in you are greeted and taking care of from start to finish pizzas are great not salty not cold not doughy wings are also amazing not from this side of town but definitely stopping by again!

n-5qU0iRKtW1Vu0jLD5hPw.text: A must try! The pizza here is so unique and delicious. Super friendly staff! We tried the carne asada and the al pastor pizza, both delicious. Super fresh ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half You Gotta Carne Asada Pizza and half Al Pastor What Pizza, yummmmmm

E08_sUM8aBMJaUMmGQJfXA.text: I'm not from New York or Chicago or even the Quad Cities, so I don't have any bias from birth on who makes the best pizza. All I know is that I love pizza.   Last night my wife and I shared a 12 inch 1/2 "Southwest Veggin Out" and 1/2 "Al Pastor WHAT?" After devouring the amazing flavor combinations of fresh veggies, delicious sauces and cheeses, I can easily say My Slice of the Pie is hands down the best pizza I have ever had.   While the pizza stands on its own, another benefit is that we were able to enjoy our food at The Whining Pig a few doors over. The pizza was brought over to us as soon as it was ready (not sure if they are able to always deliver but it was a very nice touch).   My Slice of the Pie is definitely a place I look forward to eating at again. Going back to my first sentence, I do think that Arizona has some of the best pizza in the country and I think this Pizzeria just might be at the top. Check it out and see for yourself!

UKjwFZ0UqhJqFJ7J3CcStQ.text: I'll start off by saying that I'm really, really picky & kind of a snob with pizza. I'm from NY & I have family that has also owned dozens of restaurants. I love pizza. Haven't had the best of luck in AZ so far. I tried this place and I will say it's probably the best place I've tried. I ordered a Large Thin Crust pie with Fresh Mozzarella & Grilled Chicken. The crust had a bit too much flower on the bottom but it was really solid. Sauce was good quality & the cheese was really good. I will say though, the pricing was ridiculous & would stop me from ordering often. I paid almost $30 for the pizza. That's absolutely insane. I get that Chicken & Fresh Mozz are expensive but $30? No way. I would give this place 4 Stars but pricing is a bit much. Even the best spots in NY don't charge that much.

IeH5ZpSC6VbAxWD8_knztQ.text: Friendly helpful staff, Awesome wing sauce choices, and BBQ Pizza has amazing bursts of flavors!  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ pizza added chicken

oZKWr2dqcZlKpuvRtLep7g.text: Fantastic pizza and wings. My girlfriend and I we're looking for wings the other night and couldn't find a place. Anyways a couple days later she's hangry like she always is when she wakes up and I needed to find a place ASAP. Luckily I found this place on Yelp and we decided to try it. Some of the best in Arizona. We're definitely going back

PxKTMD5flQ5amubW_pzPgQ.text: Extremely good pizza.  Probably the best crust I've ever had.  We ordered a 12" Al Pastor and it was amazing.  The service was great and the owner came out and checked on us while we were waiting (which wasn't long).   They live by the philosophy of "Keep it Simple" but DAMN do they ever do it right.  Bravo.

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Al Pastor WHAT?

W8GyVJzGJYBffAAd-Jj7SA.text: This was our first venture into Arcadia area pizza and it was a hit at our Birthday party. The sauce and toppings were delicious, we'll be ordering again!

dv_W4OepIi8F9XmiSEyurA.text: The Southwestern Veggie Pizza ("Southwest Sauce, Mozzarella, Asadero, Roma Tomato, Diced Green Chili, Roasted Corn, Red Onion, Fresh Garlic, Queso Fresco, Cilantro, Cotija") was perfection. The Carne Asada Pizza was okay, I mostly just tasted the meat and cheese, not much else despite there being other toppings - the meat must have been too overwhelming and muted the other flavors on the pizza.   Service was great! But the prices were high. For an 18" specialty pizza it came out to $28. So if you do order that one I recommend sharing it with at least two other people. Also, the bathrooms were dirty and needed some TLC.   I do like the mural, locally inspired and comic relief at the same time - Camelback Mt. as the hump of a camel.

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 1/2 Southwestern Veggie on the left, and 1/2 Carne Asada on the right.

obBWHbEaFyIiScVJC9MOLQ.text: My friends and I tried this place last night while we were next door at the bar, amazing pizza! We ordered an 18" pepperoni pizza and two large ranches, for 18$! Amazing prices and the pizza was great. Would recommend, especially coming to eat in the location (we took it back next door which is amazing that they deliver to you at the bar). The guys working were super friendly, definitely family friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PSTj6Q6bi7HQ-0T-0r8ouQ.text: Truly enjoyed our meal here, from the salads to the wings and of course the pizza. Crust is Jersey thickness, none of that cracker crust like Oreganos. Nice burnt bubbles on the crust to fight over. Sauce has been flavored properly and is not marinara out of the can. The Franks type hot wings were great, and they have blue cheese (East Coasters do not do Ranch). The service was spectacular, and though the beer selection is sparse, it is varied enough to provide you with the slight buzz that makes pizza and wings even better. WILL BE BACK.

Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome salad

xxzw6Jg21QsRwU96qOnsgw.text: This was my first time ordering from them. I had the Carne Asada pizza. Given my LOVE for pizza and Mexican food, I was intrigued.   The pizza's flavors blended together seamlessly. They honored my request for thin crust as well. I definitely will be back to try the rest of the menu but it will be hard to top this choice!  I had a friend pick up my order so I cannot comment on the cleanliness or ambiance of the establishment.

Dh7xiHxV4WlW7i9E36dcNw.text: Excellent pizza and wings. The dough has a nice light flavor to compliment the outstanding tomato sauce and flavorful cheese. Definatley will eat again. However, i had to take a star away because i placed an order to be delivered at 2 and i did not recieve it until 215.

pzh2iSn2wNVNBY57AD6Ziw.text: My wife and I recently moved to Arcadia and are always looking for local spots to try to something new. My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria did not disappoint. I happened upon the menu, mostly due to google maps. This "Pizzeria" tucked away in a strip mall with its subtle sign shouldn't fool you. Upon initially walking in, the wall art is engaging and enough for the trip alone. But obviously the whole reason you go to a Pizzeria is, well PIZZA. The New Times 2017 best of the Valley is well deserved. Their Oh My Al Pastor is one of the most unique pizzas & delicious creations ever. For the first time, I feel like Arizona can distinguish is own style of pizza based on what these guys put forward. The two times I've been, the staff has been very chatty, friendly and provide excellent customer service. Their habanero sauce, jalapeno sauce, even their regular marinara is house made and delicious. Needless to say, I will continue frequenting this place.

Via7hx2ZziISC1rR-VtBzw.text: This was the first time that I have tried this place. It's hard to get a good pizza especially for delivery but this pizza was outstanding. I've found a go to with this gem of a pie.  Highly recommend....

44vCr9XMxVBJzvvWu6SSow.text: Traveled to Arizona for work and craved some pizza.  This pizza definitely lives up to all of the raving reviews.  I had the Al Pastor and will be quite sad that I won't be in the state to have it again for quite some time.  The owner is super friendly and a real easy person to connect with.  The delivery person David was nice to speak to as well while waiting for the food.  Not only is the pizza flavor amazing, the crust is also top notch.  I totally would recommend this to family and friends.  Thumbs up!  Keep on doing what you are doing.

SilII6PO15Ii7_FIm8jMuA.text: One of the best pizza place we visited. Great pizza , wings, dessert and  customer service at a awesome price. We will highly recommend to our friends. We Will definitely visit again... from aloha state ..808

Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great pizza!!  Great service!!

F0j2e0fiBLHe70b6tnWyKA.text: Came by around 6:30pm for a slice.  Server was great and explained a lot of the menu options they have.  Wasn't busy at all but I'm thinking they may do a decent amount of delivers for their full size pizzas.  When the slice came out it looked fantastic.   Now for the taste test - crust was very good, a little heavy on the sauce, lots of pepperoni, could have used a little more cheese.  Will certainly return if I'm in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2PqJjgyRLvezhDNm4wOqDw.text: Excellent service when you should have your pizza and be ready.. Excellent quality products these guys are quite creative try their Carna Esada it's to die for!!!  EL Pastore pizza is the one I get all the time.. they're is no one in town that has this too.. try them out for sure! So h

jfpfTAt7N5Fb1sBgRel00w.text: After reading all the five-star reviews on Yelp, I decided to give My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria a try. I used to like the restaurant that was located there before, Slices of Sicily, so I was hoping the pizza would be similar or better. The restaurant had been remodeled and looked nice inside, so I initially had some hope the dining experience might be better too.  Unfortunately, My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria turned out to be a disappointment. Things did not get off to a good start when I found out they do not offer slices for dinner. This seems strange given that the word slice is in the name of the restaurant.   I could accept the lack of a slice option if the pizza had been good, but the pizza I ordered with regular sauce lacked taste and was salty. My friend got two varieties of the wings and did not care much for either. The salad I ordered was OK. Given the prices and the lack of taste of the food, I will not be returning, especially with Pizza on 40th up the street as a better alternative.

YbPqXBga8QmU2GPsIzo2kA.text: Awesome pizza! Had the Al Pastor Pizza and it's perfect. Just the right amount of spice and the ingredients are quality. Different than any other pizza place in AZ in a good way, and the staff are really great too. Five stars without a doubt!

S9qSa1c3WBiBGQ477l7zDQ.text: Sandwiches are the best come with a salad and well worth the price. Pizzas are awesome and original. Randy is knowledgeable and informative on all menu items.

p9BgkwqA9QyLo3yyADomeA.text: Pizza was delicious, owner really nice, my daughter learned how to play checkers with me on the table top boards they have, was a great experience.    I'm a plain cheese pizza snob, and this place does it right, some basil cooked under the cheese and all the right texture, consistency and taste.  Awesome job!    Also the Al pastor, holy crap good.  I'm going for the Carne asada next time.    I wish this business well and many, many years with us in Arcadia!

CVL6aQfeUjm9_dWnvatpOA.text: I've tried this place 3 times for delivery. Pizza is 20% more expensive than any of the other local options. Crust has been hard as a rock each time... And I hate to say this, but the pizza is just average.   Also a $3 "delivery" fee that doesn't go to the driver. Sorry My Slice of Pie; 3 strikes, you're out.

CGwWc7aZiJwLyXQTlRvR7g.text: We called for a delivery and just kinda winged it. Randy answered the phone and we got his recommendation and it was by far one of the best pizzas we've ever had. Get a za here. It's amazing.

I4n6vyG1hCQW7L8UoKtaNQ.text: Kids said they will come here vs PPP!! That's saying a lot! Pizza is delish here plus friendly staff :)

zla1sJrCP2rK6rUG35nhVQ.text: On the surface it seems like a pretty standard NY style pizza joint.  But what earns it the extra star is the customer service and the fresh infusion of southwestern flavors into the standard pizza menu.  Try a slice of the Al Pastor and you'll know what I mean.

vrAGpMUVNegi1I0a4gXpBQ.text: best pizza in town. the only pizza i've ever had that tasted the same heated up than it does when you first bring it home. delicious house-made ranch. highly recommend this place over any chain pizza place.

Ed127MG6IDxWxIkIAEGzHg.text: Being a pizza snob from Jersey...this place is legit! Brings me back to the east coast which is rare in AZ! Everything is amazing but to be totally honest all you need is a slice of cheese pizza to be blown away! But definitely explore the menu cause everything is top notch!

eQrglNyZznFnFLEdF7mewg.text: Randy the owner comes out and greets every single guest. Not only is it incredible pizza it's incredible service. A rare find and a must if you're in Phoenix!

GrtLQxguiCTnzi5W-IMa-g.text: Before even talking about the pizza, the customer service is awesome! We just moved here from Ca and this was the first pizza we've had out here in Az. We were very satisfied with our food. Randy was amazing! Very outgoing and welcoming. He helped us by providing sample sauces before we choose our wings(hard decision but went with the sweet and sassy and LOVED it) Great food great atmosphere and the best of all great service!!!

QLRWZlHm7MdqzBF_Nt_5xQ.text: Really great pizza! Our new go to favorite instead of Spinatos. Blanco is quite delicious

AOog9iELikK0y-ktMmASTg.text: We stopped in late Friday and grabbed a slice & thought it was super tasty. The service was great, and the pizza came out hot & delicious. We are thrilled to have another pizza option close by.

6DUytIcpTFqHE2j6F1DQSg.text: Pizza was very tasty. The manager was so dedicated to serving a product with such a high level of standard, that he replaced our order without even having to. Top notch product AND top notch customer service is a win win. I definitely suggest coming in if you're ever in the area.

8Qu8hqS2f6ir3KTOt2AwqA.text: Terrific pizza! Good yeasty but thin crust. The El Bianco was delicious. Good friendly service too.

tnuo5NcSYNoRqrhLGef-Ug.text: My only regret is that i didnt come here sooner. Amazing pizzas!  Try the al pastor!  The pineapple habanero wings are insane.  If you dont come here you're missing out

Mw1lvEEwDy_lKc5syRkruw.text: Just a great place with excellent pizza, salads and sandwiches! The staff is efficient and "Live" customer service beginning with the owner Randy on down.

pY3Dh8KKX4xN0gXq2gn4iA.text: So we ordered delivery through grubhub, only to then get a text that the pizza would be delivered 2 hours later (this is at 4:30 on a Friday). I called the pizzeria to confirm that was in fact the case, because we didn't want to wait that long. I spoke with the owner (I think) and he assured me that he would call them and if grubhub couldn't deliver within the hour he would drive it over himself. WOW! What great customer service!! Shortly after the phone call I received a text that the pizza was on the way. He called me back to make sure we got it. I was blown away with the service!! The pizza, wings, and salad were amazing, and we will continue to order from them. Thanks guys!!

0KP1mUqAYRlSOA_k3TOZMQ.text: This review is well overdue but I can only speak to the quality of the pizza and their delivery.   When they first opened I called hoping for delivery but Randy the owner hadn't had a chance to set that up but he said he'd deliver it himself.  (They now have delivery service and they are all awesome) . We ordered what has become our standby (New York crust with sausage, onions and garlic, Caesar salad with anchovies on the side) 40 minutes later Randy comes through. Super great guy and here is one of the many reasons why: I paid in cash and he said "no need for a tip", well I'm always tipping for great service whether you own the business or not and gave him the money.  The pizza is as good as it gets around here, great sauce, crust and ingredients.   The next day, I think it's around 11 am,  Randy knocks at the door, I said "hey what's up" and he hands me $20 and says: I don't think you meant to be this generous"!   Yah, no I didn't but who does that sort of shit these days?  So there ya go...great food, an amazing owner who deserves and earned my loyalty and I'm guessing you'll experience the same!  Sometimes they forget the extra sauce or something minor but it's easily overlooked,  last night the delivery guy said he'll be right back with the sauce and within 10 minutes, he was!  Okay?  Enough said?

dbRIGToiKAuckaUrUHocCA.text: best pizza, best ceasar sald, best cheesecake and outstanding staff!!! go go go

ajQZM0uIi6tqKKxQR0doEg.text: OK. After the sad closing of Mama Mia's on 40th & Indian School over a year and an half ago  I have been searching for a replacement and found it at My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria. Thank God! I tried one slice of cheese and the crust was perfect. Thin but firm and not overcooked with life in it.  The "bone" had some chew to it but it was not chewy meaning the crust was fresh and not a sad cardboard imitation of the key ingredient to a pizza. I was not prepared for an actually great pie after many tries in pizzerias around the valley. A generous portion of a tasty blend of cheese and a simple but finely spiced tomato sauce.  The menu looks quite tempting and original with smart sounding adaptations to local flavors such as roasted jalapeno garlic olive oiI, southwest sauce, Cotija cheese, Queso fresco, etc.   I will be back to try a whole pie. Simple clean space. Very nice staff and again a great pizza!

sY18XF_BkVzaUITRQXDn3Q.text: Carne asada pizza was awesome...Al Pastor pizza too. Nice touch with the BYOB offer. Definitely coming back next time we're in Phoenix area

71vsuAQJMgI2QF_9s0YJ4Q.text: Great Pizza, great service! Met the owner and he is passionate about making great, unique pizza. I tried the Al Pastor- amazing. Also tried the pizza with the Southwestern style, great taste and not too spicy. My son had a traditional NY cheese pizza and loved it!!

7Pbx8JWsQzYtXdUcZYQoog.text: Crisp, light crust with generous toppings. Unique Southwestern fusion flavors, lovingly prepared and constantly monitored by the owner. Great value. Must-try al pastor and carne asada pie by the slice. Looking forward to trying the sandwiches.

1JPdyfmYihboMB9nwKra2g.text: Delicious. They are serving up some top notch New York style pies with friendly service.  The place is a bit small but has a very down to earth and chill vibe. Cool murals on the wall and several checkerboards built into a table which spans the length of the restaurant. Bring Your Own Booze policy on alcohol it seems.  I got an 18 inch "the supreme being" which was loaded with toppings (like a deluxe or supreme). Very tasty. The veggies tasted fresh and the meats were quality.  To go pizza nerd status, the dough had good cell structure and very little or no gel line - remarkable for a pie with so many toppings. I did take a slight issue with the topping distribution on the onions (one slice had none, and the next over had many) but a minor point.  I saw that they had many interesting options and somewhat unusual toppings available. Knowing that a basic pizza is delish I'll definitely be willing to give their more interesting creations a try.  One last note, they are a bit on the expensive side. I'd say it was worth what I paid though.

qSZX66iweXDoiHOUIw4JrQ.text: As a Pizza lover from New Jersey who has been searching for pizza "like home" I with out a doubt will ONLY be getting my Friday pizza night, Pizza from here! By far he best pizza in the the valley.   Randy the owner is super friendly and has come out to see how everything was both times I have dined in. They totally deliver too in case you want to stay in or order lunch!   I recommend everyone check it out and tell everyone you know! You won't regret it.

9EhCJAanwLxT3Vk8kFq3sg.text: After reading all of the reviews from several places and recommendations from a local community website I decided to try My Slice Of The Pie.  I am from New Jersey and trying to find a place that can represent a good N.Y. style pie is very hard.  Well this place just hit the nail on the head.  I thought NYPD Pizza was good but Dang.  Perfect crust, sauce is not to spicy and did not give me heartburn. Toppings were fresh and the mushrooms are not soggy like other places.  Just found a new home for pizza and it is a local company.

SZ018kSWOWqc6QgyjwKaUQ.text: We are visiting from out of town and always use Yelp.  We enjoyed the pizza, but it was in the salty side.  We had the pepperoni pizza!  Additionally we ordered the mild wings, damn they were really good.  If we ever found ourselves in the area again, we would give them a call.

kg7-Fk8qBXHjAMsU88UYwg.text: Can you say best pizza in the city? If you can't, say it with me " BEST PIZZA HANDS DOWN"! This is coming from someone that is a major pizza enthusiast. I could eat pizza all day everyday. When I was 21, I ate pizza everyday for a month straight. I loooooove pizza, but I am a harsh critic of it. This place has a phenomenal pie. Both the traditional NY style and the very unconventional Southwest Style are absolutely amazing. This place has no competition.

qUwBaR8EFRm9LYhkF5K-nQ.text: When you come from a place known for a certain type of food, trying new places can be fraught with anxiety. What I've learned about Yelp is that everyone has an opinion and often they are very different from mine. So I went to "My slice" with cautious optimism that it was a decent pizza based on the yelp praise...Well to say it was awesome is an understatement. It is genuine, authentic kick-ass pizza!  Come to find out its owner is the brother of an old friend, just made it even better. You want great pizza in Arcadia, there is only one place to go!

QxGBq7l59uChScFX1Q0yag.text: Absolutely loved this new pizza spot! My 5 & 4 year old asked if we could go back the next day. Pizza was really good but the customer service and experience was even better! I believe it was the owner who brought out dough for my little ones to play with. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to try something different (the menu has an awesome variety of pizzas) and is looking for a kid friendly environment

mBnKLcwWHBVlDIVpMTRKMA.text: My Slice of the Pie is the go to place if you want 5 star pizza and wings. You can get a whole pie or just order by the slice. I go in to order when I am visiting the beer garden next door and they are always so kind they offer  to deliver it to me next door.  The customer service is excellent and they are so welcoming. The wings are well done and delicious and they have some original sauces to choose from. I love Mexican food and Pizza so when I find a place that can combine those two flavors Im sold. Well done Randy and team.

NgjFkwp3qvzGlydA4diaig.text: Pizza was really  good . We will be back. I recommend it come check it out . Great customer  service

6NepQmPGrlsjPYx4BMkcng.text: This place has legit pizza!  Met my husband here for a quick bite and was thoroughly impressed.  Most of the pizza in Arcadia is so-so....this was totally different.  Their specialty pizzas are creative and sound wonderful.  My husband had a slice of the Al Pastor, and it didn't disappoint.  I got a slice with numerous toppings and it was loaded!  The bottom is super crunchy, but the crust and middle are also chewy, great combo.  We will definitely be back and will take advantage of BYOB.

vf9b06X1FLnzOcJNP3XLNA.text: The pizza is SO SO good. The sauce is excellent---not too sweet or bitter, it's just perfection.  Crust is chewy but deliciously crispy on the outside. Cheese melted perfectly. We probably order takeout from here once a week---it is consistently delicious.  We order the NY Style, haven't gotten any of the specialty pies yet.  Definitely our favorite pizza in town. And owner Randy is super nice and personable---was delivering 15 pizzas for charity last time we were there. Just a great neighborhood spot and fantastic pizza.

4qfme0CV7gnBaFx9JffSnQ.text: Fantastic. Last night we tried the Al Pastor, and it was fantastic. Every single piece and every single ingredient was delicious. The crust was just right all the way through, no undercooked center on our pie.  The habenero puree can certainly step it up to next level spicy, which we loved. Service was fast and friendly.  I know we just found our place in the Phoenix area for pizza.

_r5firK9rj91DCZFKLiGvA.text: The carne assada pizza was delicious and freshly made. The delivery was quick and easy with very kind staff. We will be eating here again.

ht2f5tnJzFaGGa2zK1H1Xg.text: the best pizza ever!! no more words need said.  Well...looks like Yelp needs more words said... we love pizza, we've lived in 4 different areas of the valley and no one compares. You will not be dissapointed!

a42dCEgHiNKXWFnB6gJl1g.text: The Al Pastor pizza is insanely good! It may sound a little out there but I 100% recommend it - you won't be sorry!!

AoV1LsQXm_yAbeqvuoLwxQ.text: The pizza was awesome. I went in for just couple of slices but they stop selling by slice after 5pm so I ended up buying the 12" pizza and I'm glad I did. You gotta try it!!!

LWwLWR0WCZGy5ROBOIbYyg.text: Super friendly staff!  Ordered two salads--against pasta and rise like the Phoenix--along with a 12" pizza-the supremo. The salads were a larger size especially for the price!  Everything was super fresh and flavorful. The salads and pizza how'd tons of ingredients with a balanced taste!  The dough was perfect in that it was crunchy and moist!  Definitely my new favorite shop!!

R6BKlIz6SwEUtUT6QByXkg.text: Great little local pizza place with amazing reviews.  I was pretty impressed the whole experience.  The Pie itself was also pretty solid.  I also tried a few wings and they too were pretty damn good.  I can see why this place is a local favorite. Well done!!

bbWHM2oDYqF4zMUSbBjjaw.text: Okay, so I"m craving an Italian sandwich.  You know.  The kind with ham, salami, capocollo, mortadella, pepperoni, and/or other meats and cheeses?  It is about my favorite sub.  It's also hard to find one in this neighborhood.  Enter My Slice.  Well, I've had their pizza and I was not really impressed, but maybe they do sandwiches better?  Sadly, I don't think so.  So anyway, the Italian sandwich came on a bolilllo roll.  Ham, salami and pepperoni with red onion, roasted red pepper, pepperoncini and provolone cheese.  It was okay, but nothing to write home about.  On a bright note, it was accompanied with a quite large salad of fresh greens, crouton and shaved Parmesan.  Finally, huge banner over the front and painted on the window, #1 Pizzaria on Yelp!.  I'm thinking you can do a search for a pizzaria and find ten with higher ratings and many more reviews.  PIzzaria Bianco comes to mind, a place that has won several awards including a James Beard, a 29 Zagat rating and has been proclaimed the number one pizza in America.  1773 reviews with an average 4 stars, is not something to spit on.  Note:  the owner wrote me and claims that if you put "pizza" in the search, his restaurant comes up first. Yes, but do search results determine popularity, or is it number of reviews/stars?  Regardless, while it may be True, I think it is a bit disingenuous and misleading, but that is his call.  Subtract 1 star.

photos.caption: Photo of My Slice of the Pie Pizzeria - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #1?  Really?

mKDq7zhpbSUOtZ_uleaIYw.text: 'Twas worth the 300+ mile drive from San Diego. Lol. I was visiting my family for Christmas and I'm slowly working thru my bookmarks. It was still quite a trek from SE Gilbert, but I'd come back! This one was one of Johnjay's recommendations!  We tried the carne asada pizza, the supremo, and good ol' pepperoni. All of it was excellent!

Zy6zbnY1sNNDGpe8LKlsiQ.text: Just discovered this great little place less than a mile away from my house. Very friendly staff and the pizza is fantastic, especially if you're a fan of New York style. Definitely recommend.

fJNiOXt3PFNE7PUG78MjoQ.text: This place is phenomenal you walk in and greated with a huge smile! I ordered the elote flatbread wow! This is so good, I truly recommend it. I also ordered the supremo and half of supreme being it was as good as it looks! Oh my Goodness, I will be back!!

vD4qXS--gVZ7lSP7T8zFUg.text: great pizza & amazing guest service! wide variety of pizza sauces, toppings & styles. Also salads, sandwiches, wings & desserts.   beers on tap and a happy hour.

z2B3inTCri67GYzs7xdXPg.text: Hi i got a yellow pice paper in the mail and it say it for 90 day but there no date on the paper it's for 12in pizza but can i pot on some sausage and pepperoni on and half and half on it  get back with me ok thankyou i have eat there about two weeks ago or so ok it was good i will go for more pices on the next visit.

2Bkd2hUVDYrlQva6pBiD4Q.text: Awesome New York style pizza! Huge and tons of cheese. Extremely nice staff and fast delivery. Thanks Eli!!

8f8OyrlDhohRnAqGJFmxAg.text: Why was my food delivered in a open bag, cold, and over cooked? That is very unacceptable. I waited an hour to be extremely disappointed with my order.

cTXjcx-DTVQyHZPy1soBcQ.text: This place is the absolute best. I've had pies all around the country, Maine to New York City to California, all kinds of styles, this is among the greatest of the greats.   The presentation of the pizza is New York style, but elevated way above your average hole-in-the-wall food. When you fold it, grease doesn't flood out the back, and that's how you tell that what you taste is real and unadulterated.   The cheese is perfect, gooey and stringey with that signature mozzarella chewiness. The sauce is perfectly spiced and thick, and there's just a hint of oregano on top of the whole thing. That little extra step ties things together, and the toppings come in for the knockout. The toppings are fresh, well-prepared, and full of flavor.   Basically, this pizzeria rocked my socks off. They don't need any crazy gimmicks or experimental ingredients because they're just that damn good.  The people running it deserve every bit of good business that comes their way, and generally seem like cool, down-to earth guys that care about their product.

fBva8nesTJojyCf51n35Ug.text: Awesome Pizza. Had the carne asada and it was outstanding.  Easy ordering fo pick up.

D47nptEoCUjierFOnqwO5A.text: This is a really cool place. I was in love with the tattoo artist's mural on the wall. It is a pizza place with a SW flare added in. We had the Blanco pizza and two salads which were all delish. I am not the biggest fan of white pizza because I love Ny style  but I have to admit our pizza was very good. I will go back to try their speciality Al Pastor and a regular NY slice. I usually also do not like ranch dressing very much but their SW style ranch dressing is oh so yummy!  Oh yeah, and the thing that we really raved over was their Raspberry, Jalapeno Chipotle Cheesecake. Oh gosh! So good!   The service is amazing. The owner will wait on you and he is a delight!

K33b376ygveLwJcBVd2U0A.text: The best pizza place hands down.  You must try the Al Pastor... it is phenomenal! A perfect mixture of sweet and spicy, and the slices are huge. The owner is there literally every day and wants to make sure you have the best experience ever. 5 stars!

E4iDJP1uBTwDTILxCukgtw.text: The pizza was really good and the service was even better! We stopped in on our way to a show at the celebrity theater, and I'm so happy we found this place! Next time we're in Phoenix, we'll be back for sure!

vT3VWQ7NC-rAQ6Aq3yCKBw.text: My Italian family and I have been coming here since day one. Both the food and service are consistently top notch.  No wonder they received a New Times Best Of so early into their game. There are pizza places all up and down Indian School Road but My Slice knocks it out of the park!  Randy and his crew are "da best". I highly recommend them.

pNqXmtqUT5Tr1oELMPqT4A.text: Just had a pie from here for the first time. Went simple with a large pepperoni and it was excellent. I'll definitely be ordering again!

5W-aiillHja6XbhlY_KByQ.text: For a traditional or southwestern twist on a NY style slice, my experience here was awesome. Had a really spicy slice with jalapenos, crema and habanero pepper. My little 7 year old buddy had a cheese slice with tomato sauce. Hot, fresh, reasonable prices and friendly. Mine was awesome.Cant wait to try a whole fresh pie! I'll be a regular.  Tried the Southwest Veggie pie. Wanted my half super spicy. These guys know how to make a non-traditional SW pizza! Will definitely be back.

bsnCeQs4_qcIHfjYIZ2NOA.text: We order from here at least once a week and they deliver! Consistently good and very friendly people work there. The crust is just the right amount of crispy and chewy. Lots of toppings to choose from and giant slices to satisfy.

G7E8_iBM06hNspBT4-b0Lg.text: Went here today for lunch and had a great experience! We tried out the Rise of the Phoenix salad, as well as the Al Pastor and El Blanco pizzas. If you've ever had the al pastor at America's Taco Shop (which I love), it's the same stuff! Everything we got was super fresh and delicious. We loved the Mexican flavors combined with the crispy-yet-chewy crust.   The staff was really helpful and the service was good. The interior was clean and had a great local feel to it. We'll definitely be back!
